humanum_full_description_en:
" Calendar " refers to the calendar, which is a method of calculating the operation of the sun and the moon and the four seasons. "The New History of the Five Dynasties. "Si Tian Kao": "Calendars have constant numbers to push cold and heat." "Shu Wen": "Calendars, calendar images. From the sound of the calendar. "Historical Records" general calendar."

The word " calendar " is not seen in the Jiajin inscriptions, and ancient books are often used as " calendar " and " calendar ". Such as "Easy. "Ge": "The gentleman governs the Ming Dynasty." The "𤯍" in the inscription " Mai 𤯍 " has a form not from "甘" but from "日", which is the same as " Calendar ", but not a single word, see " 𤯌 ". Of course, the sounds of " calendar ", " 𤯍 " and " calendar " are the same, and they all follow the sound of "秝", so they can be used in ancient times.
humanum_short_description_en: " Calendar " refers to the calendar, which is a method of calculating the operation of the sun and the moon and the four o'clock seasons.
humanum_full_description:
「曆」指曆法，是推算日月運行及四時節令的方法。《新五代史．司天考》：「曆者，有常之數也，以推寒暑。」《說文》：「曆，厤象也。从日厤聲。《史記》通用歷。」

　　甲金文未見「曆」字，古書多假借作「厤」、「歷」。如《易．革》：「君子以治厤明時。」金文「蔑𤯍」 之「𤯍」有不從「甘」而從「日」之形，與「曆」形同，但並非一字，參「𤯌」。要之，「曆」、「𤯍」與「歷」音同，皆從「秝」聲，故古可通用。
humanum_short_description: 「曆」指曆法，是推算日月運行及四時節令的方法。

曆曆RS
暦暦 		厯 calendar, era
  • RS. to go through 止 a planting 厂 (happens once) of grain 秝 - one year of suns 日: calendar

(Simplified: 历)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 日 indicates the sound; 厤 (calendar) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿸ Surround from upper left
    • 厤 [ lì ] to calculate; the calendar
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
①曆法，歷術。
②曆書，按當年的日、周和月順序載有天文學等資料的出版物。
③次第，依次而定。［例］命宰歷卿大夫至於庶民土田之數，而賦犧牲，以共山林名川之祀。——《禮記·月令》。注：“歷，猶次也。”
④盡；遍。［［合］歷心(盡心，重視)；歷行(遍行，走遍)；歷問(遍問)；歷閱(遍讀)。
⑤逐一；逐個地。
歷史 [ lì shǐ ]: history; Classifiers: 门
歷程 [ lì chéng ]: course; process
歷來 [ lì lái ]: always; throughout (a period of time); (of) all-time
(Simplified: 历)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 日 indicates the sound; 厤 (calendar) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 3
Chinese: Looks like a calendar showing a pretty picture of wheat stalks, and days underneath the picture.
Meaning: calendar
Hanzi: 历
Story: Looks like a calendar showing a pretty picture of wheat stalks, and days underneath the picture.
Kind: simplified

「 曆 」指曆法，是推算日月運行及四時節令的方法。《新五代史．司天考》：「曆者，有常之數也，以推寒暑。」《說文》：「曆，厤象也。从日厤聲。《史記》通用歷。」 甲金文未見「 曆 」字，古書多假借作「 厤 」、「 歷 」。如《易．革》：「君子以治厤明時。」金文「蔑𤯍」 之「 𤯍 」有不從「 甘 」而從「 日 」之形，與「 曆 」形同，但並非一字，參「 𤯌 」。要之，「 曆 」、「 𤯍 」與「 歷 」音同，皆從「 秝 」聲，故古可通用。
" Calendar" refers to the calendar, which is a method of calculating the operation of the sun and the moon and the four seasons. "The New History of the Five Dynasties. "Si Tian Kao": "Calendars have constant numbers to push cold and heat." "Shu Wen": "Calendars, calendar images. From the sound of the calendar. "Historical Records" general calendar." The word " calendar" is not seen in the Jiajin inscriptions, and ancient books are often used as " calendar" and " calendar". Such as "Easy. "Ge": "The gentleman governs the Ming Dynasty." The "𤯍" in the inscription" Mai 𤯍" has a form not from " 甘" but from " 日", which is the same as " Calendar", but not a single word, see " 𤯌". Of course, the sounds of" calendar", " 𤯍" and " calendar" are the same, and they all follow the sound of " 秝", so they can be used in ancient times.

曆字的基本解释

曆
lì
见“历”④。

曆字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》郎擊切，入錫，來。］
亦作“厯1”。“历2”的繁体字。
(1)推算日月星辰之运行以定岁时节气的方法。
(2)推算历数的人。
(3)指历书。
(4)历运。指帝业。
(5)数目；年数。
(6)年寿；历数。
(7)指堪舆图。
(8)指记事簿。
(9)指宋代给予发解士人初请举者的记事文书。

曆字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　曆； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页500第10
〔古文〕?厤【唐韻】郞擊切【集韻】【韻會】狼狄切，?音櫟。【說文】曆象也。【書·堯典】曆象日月星辰，敬授人時。【傳】星四方中星，辰日月所會，曆象其分節，敬記天時以授人也。又【舜典】協時月正日。【疏】《世本》云：容成作曆，黃帝之臣。又【洪範】五曰曆數。【傳】曆數，節氣之數，以爲曆。【疏】算日月行道所歷，計氣朔早晚之數，所以爲一歲之曆。【正字通】曆以日爲主，故从日。其从厤者，推其所經二十八舍，正日躔也。曆法始、中、終皆舉之。先求日至以定曆元，履端於始也。參以昏星，舉正於中也。察日與天會月與日會之盈虛，齊以閏歸餘於終也。《史記》《漢書》通用歷。

曆字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体旧字形
曆字的起名意思

暂无。

calendar
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lì］
["Guangyun" Lang hits and cuts, enters the tin, come. ]
Also known as "厯1". Traditional characters of "历2".
(1) Calculate the movement of the sun, moon and stars to determine the solar terms at the time of the year.
(2) Those who calculate calendar numbers.
(3) Refers to the almanac.
(4) Calendar fortune. Refers to Emperor Industry.
(5) Number; number of years.
(6) Years of life; calendar number.
(7) Refers to the geomancy map.
(8) Refers to the notebook.
(9) Refers to the memoirs of the Song Dynasty given to the first requesters of the scholars.
calendar
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji 1] [Japanese Department] 　 Calendar; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 500 No. 10
[Ancient text]? Calendar [Tang Yun] Tan Jianqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Wolf Diqie, "Yin Qu." [Said Wen] Li Xiang also. 【Book·Yaodian】The calendar is like the sun, the moon and the stars. [Biography] The stars in the four directions of the stars, where the sun, the moon and the moon meet, look like its divisions, and remember the days and hours to teach others. Also 【Shun Code】Associate the time and the moon to be the sun. [Sparse] "Shiben" says: Rong Cheng is the author of the calendar, the minister of the Yellow Emperor. Also 【Hong Fan】Five-day calendar number. [Biography] The number of calendars, the number of solar terms, is considered a calendar. [Sparse] Calculate the calendar of the sun and the moon, and calculate the number of the morning and evening of the Qi, so it is a one-year-old calendar. 【Zhengzitong】The calendar is based on the day, so it is from the day. Those who follow the calendar will push the twenty-eight homes they have gone through, and they will be on the same day. The beginning, middle and end of the calendar are all listed. First seek the day to determine the epoch, and perform the end at the beginning. Participate in the evening star, and take the right to the center. Chasing the sun and the sky meeting the moon and the sun meeting the surplus and emptiness, Qi Yirun will return to the end. "Historical Records" and "Hanshu" general calendar.
